definition: to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially

sentences.english: Would this flatware set go with the china I bought yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 这套盘子跟我昨天买的瓷器相衬吗？

sentences.english: Blue bath rooms are appropriately watery.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色的卫生间与水相衬恰如其分。

sentences.english: Jewelry blue with green border shows men's fashion verve.
sentences.chinese: 宝蓝色衫身绿边相衬，表露出男士时装的神韵。

sentences.english: Of furniture decorate should size look line, on any account is conterminous , strewn at random have send.
sentences.chinese: 家具的布置应该大小相衬，高低相接，错落有致。

sentences.english: The informal, no- frills environment was typical of the way Dennis ran his business and his life.
sentences.chinese: 这种非正式的，低调的环境和丹尼斯的风格是相衬的。

sentences.english: But why thy odour matched not thy show.
sentences.chinese: 为何你的气味和外表不相衬。

sentences.english: Your jewelry should coordinate with the fabrics in your clothing.
sentences.chinese: 珠宝饰品应该与服装的质地相衬。

sentences.english: Experiments show that the produced images have the characteristics of phase contrast imaging.
sentences.chinese: 实验表明，结果图像呈现出了相衬成像的特点。
